channel.title: Pk Point Help PI
channel.description:
kk so i added the pk point shop and when u wield the wep u need to have the certin pk points.
but i added to shops and its worth in coins so i want to make it so when u buy the weapon off the pk shop u need pk points instead of Cash
also i want to know how when u kill somone it gives u pk points.

item.title: Pk Point Help PI
item.dc:creator: @cosar cosar
item.description:
@cosar wrote:

first at this somwhere in your ints

for the shop add this

} if (MyShopID == ##) { if (pkPoints >= TotPrice2) { if (freeSlots() > 0) { pkPoints -= TotPrice2; addItem(itemID, 1); server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1; server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) { server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { sM("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { sM("Not enough points for this item."); } }
put a number here ##
be sure u dont use an shopid that is already being used

add this to use pkpoints instead of coins

} else if (token.equals("character-pkPoints")) { pkPoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then search for youdied(); (something like that)

then add this, it will give 3 pkp for each kill

then add this to save pkpoints to your characterfile

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-pkPoints = ", 0, 21); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(pkPoints), 0, Integer.toString(pkPoints).length());

hope this helped?

Read full topic

item.title: Pk Point Help PI
item.dc:creator: @italia_kid italia kid
item.description:
@italia_kid wrote:

Add this too your client.java, just search if (MyShopID and add it under.

if (MyShopID == ##) {
if (pkPoints >= TotPrice2) {
if (freeSlots() > 0){
pkPoints -= TotPrice2;
addItem(itemID, 1);
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1;
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
if ((fromSlot + 1)
> server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) {
server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
}
} else {
sM(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
break;
}
} else {
sM(“Not enough Pking Points for this item.”);
}
}

Read full topic
